newsitem.title: UK: KEPIT advises shareholders reject TR.
newsitem.headline: KEPIT advises shareholders reject TR.

text.p: Kleinwort European Investment Trust (KEPIT) said on Friday it still recommended shareholders reject TR European Growth Trust's (TREG) offer.

TREG ealier made an improved offer for all of the issued ordinary shares and warrants of KEPIT. It said the improved offer valued KEPIT on August 19 at 96.2 pence per share on all cash election and and 28.9 pence per warrant on the same basis.
The cash offer for each unit of five KEPIT shares and one KEPIT warrant was 509.9 pence.
But KEPIT received ten other proposals earlier this week from third parties and was still studying these proposals.

"Given the number of proposals received, it is not yet possible to indicate when KEPIT's board will be in a position to make a recommendation, but the review will be completed as quickly as practicable," said the trust in a statement.
"In the meanwhile, shareholders and warrantholders are recommended not to accept TREG's offer."
